app.title: ISED - COVID-19 screening tool for visitors
error.email.valid: A valid email address is required.
error.phone.valid: A valid telephone number is required.
error.full.name.required: Full name - This field is required.
error.full.name.length.min: Full name must be at least {{minLength}} characters long
error.full.name.length.max: Full name must be less than {{maxLength}} characters long.
full.name: Full name
question: Question {{number}}
question.waiting.for.test.results: Are you currently awaiting the results of a COVID-19 test administered by public health after experiencing symptoms of COVID-19 or as a result of a potential exposure to COVID-19?
question.symptoms: Are you currently experiencing one or more of the symptoms below that are new or worsening?
question.symptoms.breathing: shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
question.symptoms.taste: new loss of smell or taste
question.travel: Have you returned from travel from outside of Canada or from another jurisdiction, and are required to quarantine?
question.close.contact: Have you been in close contact with someone:
question.close.contact.condition.one: who has tested positive for COVID-19 in the past 14 days?
question.close.contact.condition.two: with new COVID-19 symptoms in the last 14 days?
question.doctor.isolate: Has a doctor, health care provider, or public health unit told you that you should currently be isolating or staying at home?
question.close.contact.quarantine: Have you been in close contact with someone who returned from outside of Canada, and who is required to quarantine?
you.may.not.enter: You may NOT ENTER the workplace
present.pass.message: You will be asked to present this result along with your Photo ID to screeners upon entry to the ISED workplace by showing your result on your mobile device.
rejection.reason: You are being denied access to ISED premises as you answered “Yes” to at least one of the six screening questions.
situation.change: This result is no longer valid if your situation changes during the day (for example, you start experiencing symptoms).

additional.occupational.health.link.label: COVID-19 page
additional.occupational.health.message.part.one: For occupational health and safety information, please visit the

please.follow.protocols.message: Remember when in the workplace to follow all protocols and instructions
please.follow.protocols.item.signage: Follow directional signage and floor markings.
please.follow.protocols.item.sneeze.cough: Sneeze and cough into your elbow.
please.follow.protocols.item.hygiene: Use proper hand hygiene; wash your hands or use hand sanitizer.

follow.local.guidelines: Please follow local public health guidelines if you are showing symptoms.

about.content.para.one: To help ensure a safe and healthy workplace, ISED has implemented an active screening procedure for all visitors entering ISED premises. The procedure is effective November 15, 2021.
about.content.para.two: Upon your completion of the screening form, you must show your result to the designated screening officer on location.
about.content.para.three: Please note: If you answer “Yes” to any of the six screening questions, you will be denied access to ISED premises.
about.content.para.four: The tool cannot diagnose you. If you have any questions about your condition as it relates to COVID-19, please consult a healthcare provider.

privacy.notice.para.one.before.link: Your personal information is being collected pursuant to subsections 7(1)(e) and 11.1(1)(j) of the
privacy.notice.para.one.link.label: Financial Administration Act
privacy.notice.para.one.after.link: and paragraphs 124 and 125 of the Canada Labour Code, and held in Personal Information Bank No. PSE-907 (Occupational Health and Safety). It is being collected to help ensure a safe and healthy workplace for government employees, contractors, service providers and visitors, in accordance with ISED’s Occupational Health and Safety Program.
privacy.notice.para.two: The information we will collect includes your name, and your response to six questions relating to COVID-19, including: whether you exhibit symptoms; have received a diagnosis, test or health advice; have travelled; or have been in proximity to COVID-19-positive persons. This information will be retained by ISED for a period of two months and then destroyed. Your personal information will not be shared with any other federal agencies or entities outside of ISED.
privacy.notice.para.three: If you refuse to provide your personal information and consent on this screening form, you will not be permitted access to ISED premises. You will also be refused access to ISED premises if you answer affirmatively to any of the six screening questions.
privacy.notice.para.four: You have the right to ensure that personal information the Government of Canada possess about you is maintained accurately and if necessary, corrected or annotated appropriately.  If you have concerns about the accuracy of your personal information, you should contact the ATIP Services office of your employing department.  You further have the right to complain to the Privacy Commissioner of Canada regarding the manner in which the Government of Canada collects and uses your personal information.  Further information may be found on the Commissioner’s Website at:

consent.notice.para.one: By starting this screening tool, you acknowledge that you have read and understood the aforementioned Privacy Statement, and that you are providing your consent to collect your personal information under this COVID-19 screening initiative, in order to help ensure a safe and healthy workplace for government employees, contractors, service providers and visitors.

consent.and.start.message: By starting this screening tool, you consent to the terms of the above privacy notice statement.
consent.and.start.button.label: Start screening

ised.full.name: Innovation, Science and Economic Development
canada.symbol: Symbol of the Government of Canada
